title: Desert Landmarks Quiz
description: Venture into the world's great deserts and test your knowledge of their most remarkable landmarks and formations.

questions.question: Monument Valley, famous for its towering sandstone buttes, straddles the border of Arizona and which other US state?
Uluru (Ayers Rock), a massive sandstone monolith sacred to Aboriginal Australians, is located in which Australian territory?
The Sahara Desert, the world's largest hot desert, spans across how many African countries?
Wadi Rum, a dramatic desert valley also known as the Valley of the Moon, is located in which country?
The Pinnacles Desert, featuring thousands of limestone pillars, is a famous natural landmark in which country?
Death Valley, the hottest place on Earth, holds the record for the highest air temperature ever recorded. What was it?
The Atacama Desert, often called the driest place on Earth, is located primarily in which South American country?
The White Desert (Farafra) in Egypt is known for its surreal formations made of which mineral?
The Gobi Desert, one of the great deserts of Asia, stretches across Mongolia and which other country?
Sossusvlei, famous for its towering red sand dunes, some over 300 meters tall, is found in which African country?
The Joshua Tree, an iconic desert plant found in Joshua Tree National Park, is actually a species of what?
The ancient city of Palmyra, a major archaeological site in the Syrian Desert, was a thriving city in which empire?
The Lençóis Maranhenses, a desert with thousands of crystal-clear lagoons, is located in which country?
The Thar Desert, also known as the Great Indian Desert, is primarily located in which Indian state?
Salar de Uyuni, the world's largest salt flat, is located in which South American country?
